David Saff wrote:

>On 2/13/07, Ilja Preuss <it@...> wrote:

>
>>David Saff schrieb:
>>    
>>
>>>Ole,

>>>It has been proposed in the past--I can't seem to find it on Google,
>>>but I have a memory of Ron Jeffries quoting someone else who had done
>>>a small experiment of making all methods public and still having a
>>>sensible API, and had liked the results.
>>>      
>>>
>>http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?MethodsShouldBePublic perhaps?
>>

>
>Actually, it was Michael Feathers talking about FIT, it turns out
>(luckily, he did it again just now to jog my memory.  :-)
>  
>
Yeah, I started that page a long time ago.  Re people running it as an 
experiment.  I seem to remember hearing about that on the xp mailing 
list.. For some reason I'm thinking that it might have been Kay or Zhon 
Johanson(?)  I think that some team decided to make everything public 
and discovered that their tests were too coupled to their production 
code when they started to refactor.  I don't recall whether they decided 
to make data public also.  They may have.

Michael Feathers
